channel.title: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?
channel.description:
I think this is the cause of my server rejecting my client. Does anyone know how to change the 255 byte?
317 Bluuur Client with Delta 317 server.
Thanks in advance! :P

item.title: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?
item.dc:creator: @gergy008 gergy008
item.description:
@gergy008 wrote:

Is there any way to fix it then? I can’t seem to find any good tutorials is it best to go for a blank pi server source instead?

Read full topic
item.source: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?

item.title: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Vince, link=topic=468931.msg3428564#msg3428564 date=1292132790]
I knew it… Bluurrs client, delta server, headIcon.
[/quote]Don’t headIcons throw T1 / T2 errors?[/quote]

I’m not sure, I know before I loaded mine, my client would freeze, it might just be NPC bytes, or something, either way if it is the headIcon issue, it’d be best to do the billions of tutorials around here.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Vince, link=topic=468931.msg3428543#msg3428543 date=1292131686]

All your doing is stopping the client from sending a UID…

You need to stop the server from attempting to accept one.

That’s the point, if there’s a UID set on the server, replace 1000 with what the server needs to do the acceptance. Since he can logon, I don’t think it’s the UID, might be a T1/T2 however many other T errors there is.

And, the = 1337, just either change 1337 to 1000, or do what I Vain I said about the uid needed part, in Server.ini
[/quote]The UID is also configured in the client’s signlink or cache.[/quote]

He said he changed something and it gave him an error loading up, I don’t know what he changed, but I posted about the “aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method402(”, I don’t think it could be anywhere else, the number could, but the method calling…

Read full topic
item.source: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?

item.title: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]All your doing is stopping the client from sending a UID…

You need to stop the server from attempting to accept one.[/quote]

That’s the point, if there’s a UID set on the server, replace 1000 with what the server needs to do the acceptance. Since he can logon, I don’t think it’s the UID, might be a T1/T2 however many other T errors there is.

And, the = 1337, just either change 1337 to 1000, or do what I Vain I said about the uid needed part, in Server.ini

Read full topic
item.source: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?

item.title: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?
item.dc:creator: @gergy008 gergy008
item.description:
@gergy008 wrote:

Does making

int expectedUid = 1337; if (junk == expectedUid) { officialClient = true; } uid = junk;
into:

int expectedUid = 1337; /*if (junk == expectedUid) { officialClient = true; }*/ officialClient = true; uid = junk;

Not already stop the server accepting one?

Read full topic
item.source: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?

item.title: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?
item.dc:creator: @gergy008 gergy008
item.description:
@gergy008 wrote:

It doesn’t say anything anywhere, It DID say enter your username and password when it returns to the login screen.

Server said [client-disconnected] and that was it.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?

item.title: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

Did you only change this?
aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method402(1000);
That’s all that is needed to be changed, we can make this easier… When you try to logon and it rejects you, what does it say?.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing 255 byte in the client and server?

I got the

Sorry, an error has occurred whilst loading ----

Cache error I’m guessing. Comes up when it says “Starting up”
[/quote]

What did you change? There’s a few aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method402, copy your whole method84, and post it here or PM it to me…[/quote]

I thought I changed them all back…

LOTS OF CODE

[code]

{
signlink.errorname = s;
try
{

{
aString1266 = “”;

            aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_847.anInt1406 = 0;

                aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_847.method398(18);

                aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_847.method398(16);

            aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_847.method398(255);
            aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_847.method399(317);
            aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_847.method398(aBoolean960 ? 1 : 0);

            aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_847.method406(aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.aByteArray1405, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.anInt1406, true, 0);
            aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.aClass17_1410 = new Class17(-436, ai);

            aClass24_1168.method271(aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_847.anInt1406, 0, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_847.aByteArray1405, 0);
            k = aClass24_1168.method268();
        }
        if(k == 1)
        {
            try
            {
                Thread.sleep(2000L);
            }
            catch(Exception _ex) { }
            method84(s, s1, flag);

        }
        if(k == 2)
        {
            anInt863 = aClass24_1168.method268();

            aLong1220 = 0L;
            anInt1022 = 0;
            aClass48_879.anInt810 = 0;

            aBoolean954 = true;
            aBoolean1157 = true;
            aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.anInt1406 = 0;

            anInt900 = 0;
            anInt899 = 0;
            anInt1042 = -1;
            anInt1276 = -1;
            anInt857 = -1;

            anInt1018 = -1;

            anInt1221 = 3;
            anInt1225 = 0;
            aBoolean885 = false;

                    }

                    aString1267 = "Please wait 1 minute and try again.";
                    return;
                }

                return;
            }

        {
            System.out.println("response:" + k);

            aString1267 = "Please try using a different world.";
